title: Commercial Partnerships Intern - Major League Cricket
body:
---

Title: Commercial Partnerships Intern

Location: Dallas, TX | Oakland, CA | Fort Lauderdale, FL

Reports To: Commercial Partnerships Lead

Job Type: Internship (Paid)

Duration: Various (depending on location - June & July 2025)

---

Position Overview

Major League Cricket is seeking a detail-oriented and energetic Commercial Partnerships Intern to join the Commercial team. This position will focus heavily on match-day activation and on-site support, ensuring that partnership deliverables are executed to the highest standard. The ideal candidate is passionate about sports, thrives in live event environments, and is eager to gain hands-on experience in sponsorships and brand activation.

Responsibilities

Match-Day Activation & Setup

Support pre-match setup and post-match breakdown of commercial signage, activations, and hospitality areas

Ensure on-site branding and activations meet partner specifications and league standards

Liaise with venue operations, vendors, and internal teams to execute match-day deliverables

Assist with partner hospitality, including check-in, logistics, and guest experience

Capture photos/videos of branded activations for recap reports

Pre-Event Planning

Help prepare activation briefs, shipping logistics, and packing lists for each event

Coordinate credential requests, access, and scheduling for internal and external stakeholders

Track and organize all partner deliverables across matches and events

Post-Event & Reporting

Contribute to post-match recap reports, including photos, metrics, and performance highlights

Maintain internal trackers for partnership fulfillment and activation inventory

Provide feedback and suggestions for improving activation execution

General Commercial Support

Assist with sponsorship research, lead generation, and prospecting projects

Help build pitch decks, proposals, and partnership presentations

Attend internal meetings and assist with ongoing commercial initiatives as needed

Qualifications

Current student or recent graduate in Sports Management, Marketing, Business, Event Operations, or a related field

Previous experience in live event operations, sports internships, or sponsorships preferred

Available to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and travel during match periods

Highly organized with strong attention to detail and time management

Strong interpersonal and communication skills

Ability to lift, move, and set up signage and equipment as needed

Passion for cricket and/or growing sports properties is a plus

What You'll Gain

Exposure to the commercial operations of a major U.S. sports league

Hands-on experience executing live brand activations and sponsorships

Networking opportunities with internal leadership and external partners

A front-row seat to the growth of cricket in America

Professional development through mentorship and real-world experience

About Major League Cricket

Major League Cricket (MLC) is the first professional Twenty20 cricket league in the United States, featuring top international talent alongside the best domestic players. With the rapid growth of cricket in the U.S. and a successful inaugural season under our belt, MLC is building a world-class sports property focused on fan experience, innovation, and commercial excellence.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

title: Sports Presentation Intern - Major League Cricket
body:
---

Title: Sports Presentation Intern

Location: Dallas, TX | Oakland, CA | Fort Lauderdale, FL

Job Type: Internship (Paid)

Duration: Various (depending on location - June & July 2025)

---

Position Overview

Major League Cricket is looking for a creative and energetic Sports Presentation Intern to support our live event and match-day entertainment efforts. This role is ideal for someone who lives for the vibe of a packed stadium, enjoys storytelling through show production, and is eager to learn how sports presentation drives the fan experience.

Responsibilities

Match-Day Entertainment Execution

Assist with in-venue show production, including music, lighting cues, crowd prompts, and in-match entertainment

Support the setup and operation of LED boards, video screens, and PA system content

Help coordinate timing with match officials, PA announcers, DJs, and production crews

Run scripts, cue sheets, and rundowns to ensure a smooth show flow throughout each match

Assist with fan engagement elements — toss ceremonies, sponsor giveaways, crowd games, etc.

Pre-Event Planning

Help develop and prep game scripts, sponsor activations, and in-match promotions

Organize props, signage, and entertainment assets for each match

Coordinate with marketing, broadcast, and partnerships teams to integrate key messaging

Assist with rehearsals and timing checks for ceremonies, anthem performances, and special moments

Post-Match & Admin Support

Log execution of partner deliverables and entertainment elements for recap reports

Help gather fan experience feedback and insights for continuous improvement

Assist with tracking inventory and restocking presentation supplies

Qualifications

Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Sports Management, Live Event Production, Communications, or related field

Passionate about sports, entertainment, and delivering top-tier fan experiences

Comfortable in fast-paced, live event environments and able to stay cool under pressure

Excellent communicator with strong organizational and time-management skills

Available to work nights, weekends, and travel during event periods

Prior experience with event operations, show production, or live entertainment is a plus

Knowledge of cricket is a bonus — but not required!

What You’ll Gain

First-hand experience running the show during professional live sporting events

Exposure to the intersection of sports, entertainment, and fan engagement

Opportunities to work closely with production crews, on-air talent, and in-venue hosts

Creative experience developing run-of-show scripts, hype moments, and on-brand entertainment

A role in shaping the future of cricket entertainment in the U.S.

About Major League Cricket

Major League Cricket (MLC) is the first professional Twenty20 cricket league in the United States, featuring top international talent alongside the best domestic players. With the rapid growth of cricket in the U.S. and a successful inaugural season under our belt, MLC is building a world-class sports property focused on fan experience, innovation, and commercial excellence.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

title: De Kock, Omarzai Among Big Names in Revamped MI New York Squad for MLC 2025
body:
Quinton de Kock and Azmatullah Omarzai are among the marquee signings for MI New York (MINY) as they gear up for the 2025 Major League Cricket season with a refreshed and star-studded lineup. De Kock, now a full-time T20 freelancer after retiring from international cricket last year, reunites with the MI franchise for the first time in four years. The 32-year-old was a key part of Mumbai Indians’ IPL title wins in 2019 and 2020, and MINY will be counting on his explosive presence at the top of the order to spark a turnaround after a disappointing bottom-table finish last season.

Joining de Kock is fellow South African George Linde, whose recent success with MI Cape Town in their maiden SA20 triumph has earned him another T20 opportunity within the MI family. Linde will link up with Omarzai, whose stock continues to rise globally—he was recently named ODI Player of the Year. Afghan pacer Naveen-ul-Haq also joins the squad, making the switch from Texas Super Kings to bring additional firepower to MINY’s bowling unit.

The team has retained its experienced international core: Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, and Rashid Khan will once again be central to the squad’s plans. These four have formed the backbone of the team over the last two seasons and will continue to provide leadership and balance.

IPL 2025 Auction: Quinton de Kock for ₹3.6 Crore! KKR’s Top 3 Value Picks Revealed

However, some big names have made way. MINY has released Tim David, Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, and young talent Dewald Brevis following last year’s underwhelming performance.

On the domestic front, MINY has also made several changes, signing Indian domestic stars Agni Chopra, Tejinder Dhillon, Sharad Lumba, and Kunwarjeet Singh to bolster their batting depth.

The 2025 MLC season kicks off on June 12, with matches set to take place on the West Coast for the first time. The iconic Coliseum Stadium in California will host the opening fixtures, marking a new chapter for the league and MI New York alike.
summary:
**Team Updates:**

* MI New York (MINY) has signed marquee players Quinton de Kock and Azmatullah Omarzai for the 2025 MLC season.
* Other new signings include George Linde, Naveen-ul-Haq, Agni Chopra, Tejinder Dhillon, Sharad Lumba, and Kunwarjeet Singh.
* The team has retained its experienced international core, including Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, and Rashid Khan.
* Tim David, Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, and Dewald Brevis have been released from the team.

**Season Details:**

* The 2025 MLC season will kick off on June 12.
* Matches will be held on the West Coast for the first time, with the iconic Coliseum Stadium in California hosting the opening fixtures.
